channel.title: Whonixcheck doesn't show build/version number under Qubes
channel.description:
I notice that when I run whonixcheck, it does not show the line like:
Up to date: Whonix Workstation Build: 13.0.0.24
..or whatever, the way it does (I think?) with standalone whonix images under KVM or whatever.
Thus, having just downloaded and installed new WS 13 template, I have no way of verifying that it is in fact the right/newest version, and that I didn't mistakenly get a older version 11 or 12 without realizing it.
Is there any way with a GW or WS template under Qubes, to check that the right build/version is in fact being used?
Thanks.

item.title: Whonixcheck doesn't show build/version number under Qubes
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This was removed during the previous usability review. Now only shown when using whonixcheck --verbose.

Otto_Kratik:

Is there any way with a GW or WS template under Qubes, to check that the right build/version is in fact being used?

Answered here:
https://forums.whonix.org/t/any-way-to-check-qubes-version-of-a-whonix-template

Read full topic
item.source: Whonixcheck doesn't show build/version number under Qubes

item.title: Whonixcheck doesn't show build/version number under Qubes
item.dc:creator: Otto_Kratik
item.description:
I notice that when I run whonixcheck, it does not show the line like:

Up to date: Whonix Workstation Build: 13.0.0.24

…or whatever, the way it does (I think?) with standalone whonix images under KVM or whatever.

Thus, having just downloaded and installed new WS 13 template, I have no way of verifying that it is in fact the right/newest version, and that I didn’t mistakenly get a older version 11 or 12 without realizing it.

Is there any way with a GW or WS template under Qubes, to check that the right build/version is in fact being used?

Thanks.
